alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Columbia and Dutchess. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hudson, Pawling, Claverack, Amenia, Livingston, Copake, Pine Plains, Austerlitz, Ancram, Millbrook, Philmont, Millerton, Stanfordville, Dover Plains, Wingdale, Claverack-Red Mills, Lorenz Park, Hopewell Junction, East Fishkill and Beekman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
